ibis.ipl.impl

Class ReceivePort

  • java.lang.Object
    • ibis.ipl.impl.Manageable
      • ibis.ipl.impl.ReceivePort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ibis.ipl.Manageable, ibis.ipl.ReceivePort

    public abstract class ReceivePort
extends Manageable
implements ibis.ipl.ReceivePort
    Implementation of the ReceivePort interface, to be extended by specific Ibis implementations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReceivePort

        protected ReceivePort(Ibis ibis,
                      ibis.ipl.PortType type,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      ibis.ipl.MessageUpcall upcall,
                      ibis.ipl.ReceivePortConnectUpcall connectUpcall,
                      java.util.Properties properties)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a ReceivePort with the specified parameters. Note that all property checks are already performed in the Ibis.createReceivePort methods.
        Parameters:
        ibis - the ibis instance.
        type - the port type.
        name - the name of the ReceivePort.
        upcall - the message upcall object, or null.
        connectUpcall - the connection upcall object, or null.
        properties - the port properties.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when an IO error occurs

      • lostConnection

        public void lostConnection(SendPortIdentifier id,
                           java.lang.Throwable e)
        Notifies this receiveport that the connection associated with the specified sendport must be assumed to be lost, due to the specified reason. It updates the administration, and performs the lostConnection upcall, if required.
        Parameters:
        id - the identification of the sendport.
        e - the cause of the lost connection.

      • getInfo

        public ReceivePortConnectionInfo getInfo(SendPortIdentifier id)
        Returns the connection information for the specified sendport identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - the identification of the sendport.
        Returns:
        the connection information, or null if not present.

      • addInfo

        public void addInfo(SendPortIdentifier id,
                    ReceivePortConnectionInfo info)
        Adds a connection entry for the specified sendport identifier, and notifies, for possible waiters on a new connection.
        Parameters:
        id - the identification of the sendport.
        info - the associated connection information.

      • removeInfo

        public ReceivePortConnectionInfo removeInfo(SendPortIdentifier id)
        Removes the connection entry for the specified sendport identifier. If after this there are no connections left, a notify is done. A closePort(long) can wait for this to happen.
        Parameters:
        id - the identification of the sendport.
        Returns:
        the removed connection.

      • connections

        public ReceivePortConnectionInfo[] connections()
        Returns an array with entries for each connection.
        Returns:
        the connections.

      • getMessage

        public ReadMessage getMessage(long timeout)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Waits for a new message and returns it. If the specified timeout is larger than 0, the implementation waits for the specified time. This method gets called by receive() or receive(long), and may be redefined by implementations, for instance when there is no separate thread delivering the messages.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the new message, or null.
        Throws:
        ibis.ipl.ReceiveTimedOutException - is thrown on timeout.
        java.io.IOException - is thrown in case of trouble.

      • doUpcall

        public void doUpcall(ReadMessage msg)
        This method is called when a message arrived and the port is configured for upcalls. The assumption here is that when the upcall does an explicit ReadMessage.finish(), a new message is allocated, because at that point new messages can be delivered to the receive port. This method may be redefined, for instance when there is a separate thread for dealing with upcalls.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message.

      • messageArrived

        public void messageArrived(ReadMessage msg)

      • finishMessage

        public void finishMessage(ReadMessage r,
                          long cnt)
        Notifies the port that ReadMessage.finish() was called on the specified message. The port should prepare for a new message.
        Parameters:
        r - the message.
        cnt - the byte count of this message.

      • finishMessage

        public void finishMessage(ReadMessage r,
                          java.io.IOException e)
        Notifies the port that ReadMessage.finish(IOException) was called on the specified message. The port should close the connection, with the specified reason.
        Parameters:
        r - the message.
        e - the Exception.

      • closePort

        public void closePort(long timeout)
        Waits for all connections to close. If the specified timeout is larger than 0, the implementation waits for the specified time, and then forcibly closes all connections.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout in milliseconds.

      • killConnectionsWith

        protected void killConnectionsWith(ibis.ipl.IbisIdentifier id)
        Called in case an Ibis died or left. The connections originating from it must be removed.
        Parameters:
        id - the IbisIdentifier of the Ibis that left/died.

        updateProperties in class Manageable

        Overrides:
        doProperty in class Manageable

      • doPoll

        protected ReadMessage doPoll()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Implementation-dependent part of the poll() method. This version assumes that other threads deliver messages and do upcalls.
        Returns:
        a new ReadMessage or null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown in case of trouble.
